output_list.criticism: The function `sweep` calls the `transfer` function of the `Token` contract, but does not check the return value. If the transfer fails, the function will return `false`, but the caller will not know if the transfer was successful. This could lead to loss of funds for the caller.

The function `sweep` calls the `send` function of the `destination` address, but does not check the return value. If the send fails, the function will return `false`, but the caller will not know if the send was successful. This could lead to loss of funds for the caller.

The function `sweep` calls the `delegatecall` function of the `sweeperOf` function of the `sweeperList` contract, but does not check the return value. If the delegatecall fails, the function will return `false`, but the caller will not know if the delegatecall was successful. This could lead to loss of funds for the caller.

The function `sweep` calls the `logSweep` function of the `controller` contract, but does not check the return value. If the logSweep fails, the function will return `false`, but the caller will not know if the logSweep was successful. This could lead to loss of funds for the caller.

The function `sweep` calls the `makeWallet` function of the `controller` contract, but does not check the return value. If the makeWallet fails, the function will return `false`, but the caller will not know if the makeWallet was successful. This could lead to loss of funds for the caller.
